Clone an Array or an Object
Parameters:
{Array/Object} object
the object to clone
Returns:
{Array/Object} the cloned object
<static> {Boolean} Tools.compareObjects(first, second)
Compares the properties of two objects and returns true if they're the same It's doesn't do it recursively
Parameters:
{Object} first
object
{Object} second
object
Returns:
{Boolean} true if the two objets have the same properties
<static> {Number} Tools.count(object)
Count the number of properties in an object It doesn't look up in the prototype chain
Parameters:
{Object} object
the object to count
Returns:
{Number}
<static> {Object} Tools.getGlobal()
For applications that don't run in a browser, window is not the global object. This function returns the global object wherever the application runs.
Returns:
{Object} the global object
<static> Tools.getNestedProperty(object, property)
Get the property of an object nested in one or more objects given an object such as a.b.c.d = 5, getObject(a, "b.c.d") will return 5.
Parameters:
{Object} object
the object to get the property from
{String} property
the path to the property as a string
Returns:
the object or the the property value if found
<static> Tools.jsonify(object)
Transforms Arrays and Objects into valid JSON
Parameters:
{Object/Array} object
the object to JSONify
Returns:
the JSONified object or false if failed
<static> {Boolean} Tools.loop(iterated, callback, scope)
Small adapter for looping over objects and arrays Warning: it's not meant to be used with nodeList
Parameters:
{Array/Object} iterated
the array or object to loop through
{Function} callback
the function to execute for each iteration
{Object} scope
the scope in which to execute the callback
Returns:
{Boolean} true if executed
<static> Tools.mixin(destination, source, optional,)
Mixes an object into another
Parameters:
{Object} destination
object to mix values into
{Object} source
object to get values from
{Boolean} optional,
set to true to prevent overriding
<static> Tools.objectsDiffs(before, after)
Make a diff between two objects
Parameters:
{Array/Object} before
is the object as it was before
{Array/Object} after
is what it is now
Returns:
object
<static> Tools.setNestedProperty(object, property, value)
Set the property of an object nested in oen or more objects
Parameters:
{Object} object
{String} property
value
the value to set
Returns:
object if no assignment was made or the value if the assignment was made
